reviews_data.review_text: Wonderful brewery with traditional beers, nice selection of ipas and interesting sours/seltzers. Did I mention they have a huge selection of cocktails and bourbons?! The only place I’ve found with stag jr for under $20 in CLT. What truly makes it special are the bartenders; friendly, kind and knowledgeable. One of my favorite breweries in CLT
When you charge as much as it would be for a bottle, for a drink, you are stealing from your possible new clientele.

Stopped by on a Monday evening. Victoria our server was friendly and helpful as always.  I like how they split the beers by style on their screens. I also like the large bar.  When it is on tap I get “Beer Flavored Beer” yes that is the name of the beer.  It’s also in many stores.  Tonight I tried two guest taps. Both were good.  This place gets busy on Monday because it is trivia night. Small parking lot but there is parking across the street.  Dog friendly. They try to have food trucks every night.
Great beer.  Atmosphere is not for everyone.
Divine Barrel Arts was a wonderful place to host my partnership makeup class with Skill Pop. The private space was well lit, clean and set up for us and the staff was helpful and accommodating.
Good beer and good people
Good brewery especially if you are looking for a nonalcoholic option. Loved the apple rose beer they offer definitely try it.

Divine Barrel is one of our favorite breweries - so we held our wedding reception there! I cannot stress enough how awesome Jake is to work with. He made everything easy and we had a phenomenal and fun event. Thanks to the whole bar crew for all you did to make it an amazing night!

This place has the best sour I have ever had. Absolute perfection if you like that style of beer. Perception is Spoonfed 💯.
The vibe is nice inside and there is a relaxing outdoor area to enjoy the air on clear days. Certainly worth a visit if you're in the area.

One of my favorite breweries in town. Excellent sours and incredible alcoholic sodas. Super friendly staff. Constantly hosting fun events.
This review was made in connection with a Toast promotion

We go here often. By far my favorite beer selection of any brewery in CLT. While many breweries stick to a similar formula, DBB always pushes the boundaries and there's ALWAYS new stuff every time you go. Shout out to having 5oz options and flights to affordably try multiple variations! Also don't miss the trivia on Mondays! Huge indoor space, great patio, and the staff are always great.

Super creative NA options, excellent wine selection as breweries go, and as a Scot, appreciate the varied Scotch selection!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you so much for the wonderful and thorough review, Stuart! We can’t tell you how much we appreciate all of the love and support! We love having y’all for flights & trivia!!! See ya next week, friend!

reviews_data.review_text: Great beer, great people. I prefer sours and they have some really good ones. If they have lunchbox confidential when you go, get it. They also have fantastic seltzers, and my friends like their ipas and porters. They have a lot of events and food trucks.
Comfortable seating and good beer. Staff is friendly and helpful 👍🏽

Google Review for Divine Barrel Brewing

Divine Barrel Brewing is a fantastic spot for craft beer enthusiasts! Their beer selection is top-notch, with a variety of options to suit every one. Each one I tried was flavorful and well-crafted.

The brewery itself has such an inviting and laid-back atmosphere. It’s the kind of place where you can unwind, enjoy great conversation, and feel right at home. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, making the experience even better.

If you’re looking for amazing beer and a cozy, welcoming vibe, Divine Barrel Brewing is a must-visit!
Friendly and cool spot!
Great beers and service

I really enjoyed this brewery. Simple, yet complicated at the same time. I had the German Pills and the Oktoberfest. The pills was standard, but the Oktoberfest was, pun intended, Divine. I found myself reminiscing of it even as I was leaving.

This is not a brewery I will soon forget.
10/10 recommend for a private party! Jake was so responsive and accommodating during planning and the space was PERFECT for an engagement party. We had the best time!

Great relaxing atmosphere and came into town while an NFL game was going on. Everywhere else was packed and rowdy. This place was still chill even with the game going.
Beer was great
The beer is great. The people are nice. What more do you want? Don’t be a freak.

Love this place! They have creative non-alcoholic options for those of us who can't drink (the lavender soda Moon and the Fog is just *beautiful!* and light on the sugar) and the vibe is always very chill when I've been. They also have rotating pinball machines and I can't resist Ghost Busters when it's there! The staff is super friendly and there's lots of free parking on the lot across the street which is a hard find in the Noda area!
Moment of Divine Clarity was so much fun. DJ was fire and the beer was tasty
I enjoyed the hell out of myself here with a lot of friendly people.
Best brewery in Charlotte.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Wow John, that’s some incredibly high praise, and we can’t thank you enough! We hope you’ll come back to see us soon at our little NoDa brewery! Cheers John!

reviews_data.review_text: Great beer, good space, and incredibly nice people. Appreciated the options (I love sours and I think they had 4 or so when we went). Boyfriend loved Dank Zappa IPA (both the beer and the pun). We were just visiting the area but if I lived in Charlotte this would definitely be my go-to. Bartender recommended some other local breweries too, and the ones we checked out did not disappoint. LONG LIVE BAT BOY.

Great brewery - the vibe and the beers a re just right. I like the Czech Pilsner, Life flows on (Amber) and the hoppy Dank Zappa (West coat IPA).
There are plenty event around the brewery (Food truck festivals, live music). It’s a great place to hang out.

Drinking for years and finally got to visit. Love this place and especially the exceptionally creative labels on the beer. I feel like I get an idea of the spirit of the drink from the labels.

if you are new to Divine, I would encourage getting a flight so you can sample the variety because it’s easy to drink here. Atmosphere is very chill and relaxed.
The best brewery in Charlotte. Amazing staff, super friendly atmosphere. A must-visit in you're in the area!
Great atmosphere, and I've never had a bad beer here!

Tucked away spot that really is a gem..

The place just feels like good energy.
Beertender was super cool. Had a nice chat and he pointed me in the direction of some other must try breweries while I was in town..

Spacious with a cool rustic yet modern warehouse type of feel.  Small poured a handful of their IPAs and was not disappointed.  Everything was clean,  balanced,  delicious.. I'm a fan.

Didn't ask the story behind the name.. Google here I come.

This place right here!!! I tell you, we had NO idea that this brewery existed, but sooo glad we did!  The whole vibe and atmosphere there was awesome. The staff was cool and very friendly, and the art! These guys really seem to support local art. They had some amazing pieces around the room, and supposedly they switch it up monthly to support new artists. Me & the crew may have found our new favorite hangout spot!
Great service and always a beer on tap that I like. Dog friendly too!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you very much for the kind review, Melissa! We're so glad you enjoyed your visit. We keep our taps at the ideal temperature for serving beer, so if we went any colder then it would affect the beer itself. We hope you'll come back and visit us again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Fantastic drink selections and local social events 🙌🏾✨✨
We love this little brewery tucked away near NODA
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you so much for coming to visit us, Jo! We’re so happy you enjoy coming to see us so much, and we truly appreciate the love and support! See you soon!!!

reviews_data.review_text: Super cool owner and great beer! Highly recommend!
Solid brewery... had a little bit of everything as far as beer is concerned. Ipa's, hazy's, dark, crisp, sour's... also a couple of draft cocktails!

To say this place is a diamond in the rough is an understatement!! We reserved Divine Barrel Brewing for our son's post-wedding brunch. From the first time I met Jake Bock and his team, I was put at ease. From the scheduling to the organizing and set-up, was nothing short of professional and effortless! Everyone we met was extremely courteous and friendly! They helped any way they could and made sure that us and our guests were comfortable and had a great time! They truly went above and beyond and made this groom's mother one happy person!!! Thank you Jake and crew for helping to make our event one very special and memorable one!!!
The vibes are immaculate: great music, video games, and great non alcoholic options (try the cream soda). Not to mention the staff are so kind!

I've been going to DBB since it opened, and it's really cool to see the true community hub it's grown into. Service is always top notch across the board, and it's clear how committed they are to showcasing local artists & food vendors (their truck rotation is terrific). The NoDaHood markets they host every few months are always a blast.

For their core offerings - the taproom & patio atmospheres are welcoming to everyone and really clean; they recently added some pinball machines to compliment all of the tabletop and board games.

And last but certainly not least - the beer. They'll almost always have something for everyone; clean classics, fun sours, heavier dark beers, stuff that's barrel-aged, solid cocktails, wine, and n/a offerings that are tasty and open the place up even more to families.

They do a little bit of everything and do it well. They're THE destination for me when I get to that part of the city.
Knowledgable and attentive staff, fun environment, and damn good beer. Taylor was a phenomenal bartender!

One of my favorite breweries in all of Charlotte, NC.  They aren't afraid to experiment with different styles of beer. Large venue, small record store and a number of non alcoholic and non beer options.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Preston! We can't thank you enough for such a thoughtful and kind review of our little NoDa brewery! We sincerely appreciate the kind words, and we do love to experiment! Glad you were able to peep the record store. We also work with several other small businesses who sell Charlotte themed apparel, plants and soy candles! We also like to make sure we have more than just beer! We know there are plenty of non-beer drinkers out there! Cheers, and we hope to see you back at the taproom soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Pleasant place
My favorite brewery, great selection, great people
reviews_data.owner_answer: We can’t tell you how much we appreciate the kind words, and are so happy you love DBB so much! We sincerely appreciate you Amanda, and we’ll keep trying to make you proud! Come back and see us again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: The best beers in charlotte
One of my favorite breweries, one of the best in NoDa

Keep pouring

reviews_data.review_text: I didn't think I could love Divine Barrel more until they had drag brunch! It was an amazing event! The entertainment was top-notch! Onya Nerves knows how to put together a wonderful set! I can't wait to come back for brunch!

reviews_data.review_text: Divine Barrel is like the bar from Cheers, once you're a regular, the staff all know your name! It's a great brewery, lots of variety in beer options, lots of activities during the week, and dog friendly.

reviews_data.review_text: Another great NoDa brewery to enjoy. Great on tap beer selections. An array of activities noted on different nights of the week to keep you coming back.

reviews_data.review_text:

reviews_data.review_text: Me and my Partner have been coming here consistently for quite a while. This is our comfort brewery for sure! It’s so hard to find a place that is 10/10 for all of these things. If you’re thinking about trying it out, do yourself a favor! Oh and the moonbeams stout is fantastic.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Tystan, this is such an incredibly kind review! We seriously can't thank you enough for the wonderful words! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: My absolute favorite brewery. I make the drive from Rock Hill up this way when I can. They have the best hazy IPAs and sours. reviews_data.review_text:
A Spirited Journey at Divine Barrel Brewing

Rating: ★★★★★ 5/5

Last weekend, I had the pleasure of visiting Divine Barrel Brewing, a hidden gem nestled in the heart of Charlotte. From the moment I walked in, I was captivated by the warm and inviting atmosphere, the delightful fusion of old-world charm and modern flair, and the genuine passion for brewing that emanated from every corner of the establishment.

Ambiance: ★★★★★ 5/5
The brewery boasts an impeccably designed space, combining rustic wood accents with sleek industrial elements to create a one-of-a-kind environment. The outdoor patio area, adorned with string lights, is perfect for soaking in the local vibes and enjoying a pint with friends on a warm evening.

Beer Selection: ★★★★★ 5/5
Divine Barrel Brewing takes pride in their extensive and diverse beer selection. From traditional styles like IPAs and stouts to more experimental offerings like sours and barrel-aged brews, there's a beer for every palate. I was particularly impressed by their commitment to sourcing local ingredients and the intriguing seasonal options that showcased the creativity of their master brewer.

Service: ★★★★★ 5/5
The staff at Divine Barrel Brewing are friendly, knowledgeable, and eager to help you find your perfect pint. Their enthusiasm for craft beer is contagious, making it a joy to learn about the brewing process and the stories behind each brew. They truly elevated the experience.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Vishal, this has to be the most thorough and tear-inducing review we've ever received! Thank you so much for the incredibly thoughtful and helpful review for folks to check out! It was a pleasure meeting you last week, and we're so happy you had such a great experience with us! We look forward to serving you again whenever you're able to make it by the taproom again. Cheers friend, and be well!

reviews_data.review_text: Love Divine Barrel Brewing in Charlotte NC! Been here a bunch of times. They have an amazing selection of beers including my favorite, sours! They had one collar with Salud- Hermosa Tonteria- was the best/ was in a can tho. I had another delicious sour on draft. Blood orange , pineapple and mango- omg amaze! Love the outdoor space, so did my two dogs. They are next door to Deejai and Craft wine! So excited to come back and try new things!!
We visited for their 5 year anniversary and it was so much fun! The beer was good and the band was awesome!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you so much for the kind words, S. A.! We sincerely appreciate all the love, and thank you so much for coming to hang out with us for our Funkin' 5 Anniversary Party! We hope you'll come back again soon to visit us here in NoDa!

reviews_data.review_text: Great place, unless it's crowded, which is most of the time.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thanks so much for stopping by, Jacob, and we were certainly busy during our The DROP event last week. Gavin, our Owner and Operations Manager, even hopped behind the bar that night to help serve. We hope you'll come back soon to see us, busy or not. Cheers!

reviews_data.review_text: Great place, great staff, great beer. Definitely a local favorite.

reviews_data.review_text: What great flavor profiles they have for beers.  Some traditional beers but their takes on flavors is extraordinary.   Flights available.

reviews_data.review_text: Great beer selection and atmosphere.  However, they need to do something about the smell….strong farm animal smell. Was with a group of 7 and we left quickly after one round.

reviews_data.review_text:
Love this brewery. Good people, good beer, doing good things for the community. Friendly bar staff, and a clean atmosphere. And dog friendly? Yes, yes please. I'll pair pups and pints any day. Oh, and it's totally ok to come hungry - they have food trucks all the time!
Staff told me that they're selling throughout NC, really excited to be able to pick it up at my favorite bottle shop when I'm not on this side of town. See you again soon DBB!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you so much for the incredibly thoughtful and thorough review, Kelly! We can't tell you how much we appreciate your kind words, and definitely look for our beer across CLT in accounts! You can find our beer in most bottle shops, some restaurants, and beer bars!

reviews_data.review_text: Great stop for a drink, amazing selections. Loved the atmosphere. Food trucks right outside. Pet friendly. The staff was very friendly. And clean bathrooms.

reviews_data.review_text: One of our favorite places in NODA.

reviews_data.review_text:
Divine Barrel is quickly becoming one of my favorite NC craft breweries. Tucked away cool little spot in the Northeast of Charlotte in the NoDa district Divine Barrel offers some truly unique beers.

I first encountered Divine Barrel in Wilmington Nc where I tried the Lunchbox Confidential and Holy Cow it’s a Peanut Butter and Jelly sandwich in a can. I was super excited about finally getting to visit the tap house.

The space is super cool with a large outdoor patio and plenty of seating inside. We got a flight and really enjoyed every expression they offered. The Ice cream Paint job and Lunchbox were super crushable!

Can’t wait for another visit which shhh (I’m headed there now)

Update 9/18/21

reviews_data.review_text:
One of Best Breweries in Charlotte!!

Overall: we can't say enough great things about Divine Brewing. We had the chance to visit 7 breweries on our weekend trip to Charlotte and this was one of absolute favorites!! Everything you could want in a great experience at a brewery. Beer is fantastic across the board. The service was helpful and friendly. Cool interior and outside seating. Several food trucks in the area and excellent merch to top it off. We had several flights and came back the following day on the way out of town to grab some to go as well, including two glasses, and a tshirt. This ranks up there with some our favorite all-time along with Sweetwater (ATL), Slow Pour (Lawrenceville, GA), Creature Comforts (Athens, GA), and Against the Grain (Louisville). Amazing!!!
'
Beer: almost everything we tried we loved. Got two flights and went back for more. We had their Double Rainbow (9/10), Blueberry Cobbler (10/10), Cherry Connick (9/10) and several others were strong too, Casual (7/10) and Zappa (7/10). The Cobbler was so good that we went back the next day on the way out of town to grab a to-go. We also grabbed a single of Fritter Waste (cinnamon sticks and apple fritter with cake batter sour ale). You heard me correctly!  :)

Service: extremely friendly, helpful, and welcoming both times we came in.

Location/Interior/Patio: it is definitely tucked away a little bit north of the NoDa area. We took the light rail to 36th street station and Google Maps took us all over the place, when there was a more direct route. It is very non-descript in a more industrial place, but is located by a bar and grill and noodle shop. That area seems to be booming with new construction going on all around. Interior is cool with tables and couches. Outside is not terribly big, but it was perfect for a pretty sunny day.

Merch: they have some really cool merchandise. They have really cool glasses, a great logo, multitude of tshirts, bundles, and really cool artwork for their beers.

Summary: one of our favorite breweries we've ever visited!!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Holy cannoli, Dawson! What a thorough, and well thought out review! We can’t tell you how happy this made us to read all the way through, and it makes us feel great to see us compared to such amazing breweries you’ve visited! Cheers, and we hope you’ll come back for some more delicious sour beer in the near future!

reviews_data.review_text: Excellent! Great brews, friendly staff, and good Covid awareness. We sat outside and enjoyed a beautiful Sunday afternoon.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you so much, Ken! We truly appreciate all of the kind words, especially about Covid-19 safety! We’ve been extremely serious about trying to keep all who visit + our staff safe during this difficult year, so we’re incredibly glad to hear you felt comfortable relaxing!!!

reviews_data.review_text:

They have a variety of different options for all types of beer drinkers and have some non-alcoholic drinks for all the saints out there. Brought my wife here for her birthday and she enjoyed it a lot! They also have a few table games and a Nintendo 64.

Oh and when a train passes raise your glasses!!

reviews_data.review_text: Highly recommend the berliners, but the one dark beer was also excellent.  They also fill crowlers properly with a rinse and CO2.

reviews_data.review_text: My FAVORITE brewery in Charlotte without a doubt. Divine Barrel offers a wide range of rotating beers, and Ben (brew master) comes up with delicious new recipes all the time. I didn't drink any beer at all, until I tasted their sours, which are absolutely delicious. I since had to change my diet to gluten free, but that's no problem thanks to rotating kombucha, ciders, a wonderful wine list, and delicious ginger ale from GA. The staff are absolutely fantastic and make you feel like you're part of their family. If you're into running or you want to try it out, come on Thursdays for Divine Barrel Brewing run club (RunDBB). It's a super laid back and welcoming group with all paces and they offer 1, 2, and 3 mile routes. The ambience is super nice, I especially love the hanging plants and that they allow dogs. There's also a bunch of table top games that are fun and addictive. If you haven't tried DBB yet, you're missing out.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Bibi, we can’t thank you enough for this amazing review and for ALLLLLLLLL of your amazing support! We absolutely love and appreciate you so much! You ARE a part of the family!

Vibe is good(hopefully doesn't change to typical noda) games to play, and ppl to meet! Def coming back.

reviews_data.review_text:
The beer’s always good when it’s barrel-aged in the NoDa ‘hood!⁣
⁣
This spacious brewery offers a variety of highly-stylized beers that will impress even the staunchest of beer snobs.
⁣
With ampleparking + seating they also offer plenty of types of entertainment to enjoy between sips including video, bar, and old school games .
⁣
They are also dog-friendly and Lynx Blue Line adjacent, so you come on down and raise a glass w/every train pass!

Staff is friendly & accommodating.

My one little thing is I tend to shy away from places that price their sample size 5oz pours individually. While it’s great to not be forced to try a set amount or have the the freedom to not be restricted to a fixed number; it can get expensive, fast! Rather than a prix-fixe price of a flight from $7-12 at most breweries, depending on which beers you get, your tab can add up quick.

But, that aside, I definitely enjoyed my visit here!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thanks so much for stopping by, and so glad you enjoyed your time with us! We prove our 5oz options to be within the flight pricing model should someone choose to select up to four 5oz options. Our pricing should definitely fall within that $7-$12 range like most places! Of course, there are several beers on ours that just are more expensive to produce. But I promise, we are very thoughtful, and try to be as reasonable to our customers as we can!

reviews_data.review_text: One of my absolute favorite neighborhood spots. Great IPA’s with flavorful sours and a constantly changing tap of odd and different beers. A must try beer experience.
reviews_data.owner_answer: You’re da best, Devon! Thanks so much for the amazing review! We love to hear that we’re one of people’s favorite stops in the neighborhood. We know there are a ton of amazing spots in NoDa, so this means the world to us! Cheers, and see you soon!

reviews_data.review_text:

reviews_data.review_text: first visit.  it's kinda hidden on side of building, but totally worth scouting this new neighberhood brewery.  got try both IPA and stout which were top notch. though sours aren't my thing, overhearing othet patrons raving about the sours.

reviews_data.review_text: Tasty sours.

reviews_data.review_text: Wonderful brewery with traditional beers, nice selection of ipas and interesting sours/seltzers. Did I mention they have a huge selection of cocktails and bourbons?! When you charge as much as it would be for a bottle, for a drink, you are stealing from your possible new clientele.

Stopped by on a Monday evening. Victoria our server was friendly and helpful as always.  I like how they split the beers by style on their screens. I also like the large bar.  When it is on tap I get “Beer Flavored Beer” yes that is the name of the beer.  It’s also in many stores.  Tonight I tried two guest taps. Both were good.  This place gets busy on Monday because it is trivia night. Small parking lot but there is parking across the street.  Dog friendly. They try to have food trucks every night.

Divine Barrel is one of our favorite breweries - so we held our wedding reception there! I cannot stress enough how awesome Jake is to work with. He made everything easy and we had a phenomenal and fun event. Thanks to the whole bar crew for all you did to make it an amazing night!

This place has the best sour I have ever had. Absolute perfection if you like that style of beer. Perception is Spoonfed 💯.
The vibe is nice inside and there is a relaxing outdoor area to enjoy the air on clear days. Certainly worth a visit if you're in the area.

One of my favorite breweries in town. Excellent sours and incredible alcoholic sodas. Super friendly staff. Constantly hosting fun events.
This review was made in connection with a Toast promotion

We go here often. By far my favorite beer selection of any brewery in CLT. Google Review for Divine Barrel Brewing

Divine Barrel Brewing is a fantastic spot for craft beer enthusiasts! Their beer selection is top-notch, with a variety of options to suit every one. Each one I tried was flavorful and well-crafted.

The brewery itself has such an inviting and laid-back atmosphere. It’s the kind of place where you can unwind, enjoy great conversation, and feel right at home. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, making the experience even better.

If you’re looking for amazing beer and a cozy, welcoming vibe, Divine Barrel Brewing is a must-visit!
Friendly and cool spot!
Great beers and service

I really enjoyed this brewery. Simple, yet complicated at the same time. I had the German Pills and the Oktoberfest. The pills was standard, but the Oktoberfest was, pun intended, Divine. I found myself reminiscing of it even as I was leaving.

This is not a brewery I will soon forget.
10/10 recommend for a private party! Jake was so responsive and accommodating during planning and the space was PERFECT for an engagement party. We had the best time!

Great relaxing atmosphere and came into town while an NFL game was going on. Everywhere else was packed and rowdy. This place was still chill even with the game going.
Beer was great

The staff is super friendly and there's lots of free parking on the lot across the street which is a hard find in the Noda area!

Bartender recommended some other local breweries too, and the ones we checked out did not disappoint. LONG LIVE BAT BOY.

Great brewery - the vibe and the beers a re just right. I like the Czech Pilsner, Life flows on (Amber) and the hoppy Dank Zappa (West coat IPA).
There are plenty event around the brewery (Food truck festivals, live music). It’s a great place to hang out.

if you are new to Divine, I would encourage getting a flight so you can sample the variety because it’s easy to drink here. Atmosphere is very chill and relaxed.

Tucked away spot that really is a gem..

reviews_data.review_text: Super cool owner and great beer! Highly recommend!

To say this place is a diamond in the rough is an understatement!! We reserved Divine Barrel Brewing for our son's post-wedding brunch. From the first time I met Jake Bock and his team, I was put at ease. From the scheduling to the organizing and set-up, was nothing short of professional and effortless! Everyone we met was extremely courteous and friendly! They helped any way they could and made sure that us and our guests were comfortable and had a great time! They truly went above and beyond and made this groom's mother one happy person!!! Thank you Jake and crew for helping to make our event one very special and memorable one!!!
The vibes are immaculate: great music, video games, and great non alcoholic options (try the cream soda). Not to mention the staff are so kind!

I've been going to DBB since it opened, and it's really cool to see the true community hub it's grown into. Service is always top notch across the board, and it's clear how committed they are to showcasing local artists & food vendors (their truck rotation is terrific). The NoDaHood markets they host every few months are always a blast.

For their core offerings - the taproom & patio atmospheres are welcoming to everyone and really clean; they recently added some pinball machines to compliment all of the tabletop and board games.

And last but certainly not least - the beer. They'll almost always have something for everyone; clean classics, fun sours, heavier dark beers, stuff that's barrel-aged, solid cocktails, wine, and n/a offerings that are tasty and open the place up even more to families.

They do a little bit of everything and do it well. They're THE destination for me when I get to that part of the city.
Knowledgable and attentive staff, fun environment, and damn good beer. Taylor was a phenomenal bartender!

One of my favorite breweries in all of Charlotte, NC.  They aren't afraid to experiment with different styles of beer. Large venue, small record store and a number of non alcoholic and non beer options.

reviews_data.review_text:
A Spirited Journey at Divine Barrel Brewing

Rating: ★★★★★ 5/5

Last weekend, I had the pleasure of visiting Divine Barrel Brewing, a hidden gem nestled in the heart of Charlotte. From the moment I walked in, I was captivated by the warm and inviting atmosphere, the delightful fusion of old-world charm and modern flair, and the genuine passion for brewing that emanated from every corner of the establishment.

Ambiance: ★★★★★ 5/5
The brewery boasts an impeccably designed space, combining rustic wood accents with sleek industrial elements to create a one-of-a-kind environment. The outdoor patio area, adorned with string lights, is perfect for soaking in the local vibes and enjoying a pint with friends on a warm evening.

Beer Selection: ★★★★★ 5/5
Divine Barrel Brewing takes pride in their extensive and diverse beer selection. From traditional styles like IPAs and stouts to more experimental offerings like sours and barrel-aged brews, there's a beer for every palate. I was particularly impressed by their commitment to sourcing local ingredients and the intriguing seasonal options that showcased the creativity of their master brewer.

Service: ★★★★★ 5/5
The staff at Divine Barrel Brewing are friendly, knowledgeable, and eager to help you find your perfect pint. Their enthusiasm for craft beer is contagious, making it a joy to learn about the brewing process and the stories behind each brew. They truly elevated the experience.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Vishal, this has to be the most thorough and tear-inducing review we've ever received! Thank you so much for the incredibly thoughtful and helpful review for folks to check out! It was a pleasure meeting you last week, and we're so happy you had such a great experience with us! We look forward to serving you again whenever you're able to make it by the taproom again. Cheers friend, and be well!

reviews_data.review_text: Love Divine Barrel Brewing in Charlotte NC! Been here a bunch of times. They have an amazing selection of beers including my favorite, sours! They had one collar with Salud- Hermosa Tonteria- was the best/ was in a can tho. I had another delicious sour on draft. Blood orange , pineapple and mango- omg amaze! Love the outdoor space, so did my two dogs. They are next door to Deejai and Craft wine! So excited to come back and try new things!!
We visited for their 5 year anniversary and it was so much fun! The beer was good and the band was awesome!

reviews_data.review_text:
Love this brewery. Good people, good beer, doing good things for the community. Friendly bar staff, and a clean atmosphere. And dog friendly? Yes, yes please. I'll pair pups and pints any day. Oh, and it's totally ok to come hungry - they have food trucks all the time!
Staff told me that they're selling throughout NC, really excited to be able to pick it up at my favorite bottle shop when I'm not on this side of town. See you again soon DBB!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you so much for the incredibly thoughtful and thorough review, Kelly! We can't tell you how much we appreciate your kind words, and definitely look for our beer across CLT in accounts! You can find our beer in most bottle shops, some restaurants, and beer bars!

reviews_data.review_text:
I always have a good time here. The staff is friendly and knows their beer!

The location is big enough to not feel crowded but still feels homey.

The last time I was there they even had an artist doing free caricatures which was really fun. The artist was also a super nice guy.

Excellent place that’s well worth a stop.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you so much for the wonderfully thoughtful review, Kayleigh! We sincerely appreciate your kind words and support! We love to hear you felt at home here, and we've always got fun events and people popping up here, so we hope to see you back at our NoDa taproom again soon! Cheers!

reviews_data.review_text: Best sours in Charlotte

reviews_data.review_text: Great stop for a drink, amazing selections. Loved the atmosphere. Food trucks right outside. Pet friendly. The staff was very friendly. And clean bathrooms.

reviews_data.review_text: One of our favorite places in NODA.

reviews_data.review_text: Such fantastic beer! Loved the Defensive Pancake and the Crooked Paint Job. Ordered a noodle bowl from Deejai's - also fabulous! Great atmosphere!

reviews_data.review_text:
Divine Barrel is quickly becoming one of my favorite NC craft breweries. Tucked away cool little spot in the Northeast of Charlotte in the NoDa district Divine Barrel offers some truly unique beers.

I first encountered Divine Barrel in Wilmington Nc where I tried the Lunchbox Confidential and Holy Cow it’s a Peanut Butter and Jelly sandwich in a can. I was super excited about finally getting to visit the tap house.

The space is super cool with a large outdoor patio and plenty of seating inside. We got a flight and really enjoyed every expression they offered. The Ice cream Paint job and Lunchbox were super crushable!

Can’t wait for another visit which shhh (I’m headed there now)
reviews_data.owner_answer: Rob, this is such a wonderful review, and we seriously can't thank you enough for all the love! We're so glad you think we're one of the best breweries in North Carolina! We'll keep coming up with creative and fun beers for you, so come back to see us again soon! Cheers friend, and thanks again for the love!

reviews_data.review_text: Great beer! Huge amount of taps for a brewery. I shall return!

Update 9/18/21
Beers are very good, here for Oktoberfest, their Märzen was best in town, staff very friendly, dog issue not as bad as previous. Great craft beer spot
reviews_data.owner_answer:
Thanks so much for coming by for our Oktoberfest, Jim. We’re sorry you have an issue with pups in the taproom. It’s perfectly legal for us to allow them in, unless we’re serving food inside.

reviews_data.review_text:
One of Best Breweries in Charlotte!!

Overall: we can't say enough great things about Divine Brewing. We had the chance to visit 7 breweries on our weekend trip to Charlotte and this was one of absolute favorites!! Everything you could want in a great experience at a brewery. Beer is fantastic across the board. The service was helpful and friendly. Cool interior and outside seating. Several food trucks in the area and excellent merch to top it off. We had several flights and came back the following day on the way out of town to grab some to go as well, including two glasses, and a tshirt. This ranks up there with some our favorite all-time along with Sweetwater (ATL), Slow Pour (Lawrenceville, GA), Creature Comforts (Athens, GA), and Against the Grain (Louisville). Amazing!!!
'
Beer: almost everything we tried we loved. Got two flights and went back for more. We had their Double Rainbow (9/10), Blueberry Cobbler (10/10), Cherry Connick (9/10) and several others were strong too, Casual (7/10) and Zappa (7/10). The Cobbler was so good that we went back the next day on the way out of town to grab a to-go. We also grabbed a single of Fritter Waste (cinnamon sticks and apple fritter with cake batter sour ale). You heard me correctly!  :)

Service: extremely friendly, helpful, and welcoming both times we came in.

Location/Interior/Patio: it is definitely tucked away a little bit north of the NoDa area. We took the light rail to 36th street station and Google Maps took us all over the place, when there was a more direct route. It is very non-descript in a more industrial place, but is located by a bar and grill and noodle shop. That area seems to be booming with new construction going on all around. Interior is cool with tables and couches. Outside is not terribly big, but it was perfect for a pretty sunny day.

Merch: they have some really cool merchandise. They have really cool glasses, a great logo, multitude of tshirts, bundles, and really cool artwork for their beers.

Summary: one of our favorite breweries we've ever visited!!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Holy cannoli, Dawson! What a thorough, and well thought out review! We can’t tell you how happy this made us to read all the way through, and it makes us feel great to see us compared to such amazing breweries you’ve visited! Cheers, and we hope you’ll come back for some more delicious sour beer in the near future!

We’ve been extremely serious about trying to keep all who visit + our staff safe during this difficult year, so we’re incredibly glad to hear you felt comfortable relaxing!!!

reviews_data.review_text: My FAVORITE brewery in Charlotte without a doubt. Divine Barrel offers a wide range of rotating beers, and Ben (brew master) comes up with delicious new recipes all the time. I didn't drink any beer at all, until I tasted their sours, which are absolutely delicious. I since had to change my diet to gluten free, but that's no problem thanks to rotating kombucha, ciders, a wonderful wine list, and delicious ginger ale from GA. The staff are absolutely fantastic and make you feel like you're part of their family. If you're into running or you want to try it out, come on Thursdays for Divine Barrel Brewing run club (RunDBB). It's a super laid back and welcoming group with all paces and they offer 1, 2, and 3 mile routes. The ambience is super nice, I especially love the hanging plants and that they allow dogs. There's also a bunch of table top games that are fun and addictive. If you haven't tried DBB yet, you're missing out.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Bibi, we can’t thank you enough for this amazing review and for ALLLLLLLLL of your amazing support! We absolutely love and appreciate you so much! You ARE a part of the family!

reviews_data.review_text:
The beer’s always good when it’s barrel-aged in the NoDa ‘hood!⁣
⁣
This spacious brewery offers a variety of highly-stylized beers that will impress even the staunchest of beer snobs.
⁣
With ampleparking + seating they also offer plenty of types of entertainment to enjoy between sips including video, bar, and old school games .
⁣
They are also dog-friendly and Lynx Blue Line adjacent, so you come on down and raise a glass w/every train pass!

Staff is friendly & accommodating.

My one little thing is I tend to shy away from places that price their sample size 5oz pours individually. While it’s great to not be forced to try a set amount or have the the freedom to not be restricted to a fixed number; it can get expensive, fast! Rather than a prix-fixe price of a flight from $7-12 at most breweries, depending on which beers you get, your tab can add up quick.

But, that aside, I definitely enjoyed my visit here!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thanks so much for stopping by, and so glad you enjoyed your time with us! We prove our 5oz options to be within the flight pricing model should someone choose to select up to four 5oz options. Our pricing should definitely fall within that $7-$12 range like most places! Of course, there are several beers on ours that just are more expensive to produce. But I promise, we are very thoughtful, and try to be as reasonable to our customers as we can!

reviews_data.review_text: One of my absolute favorite neighborhood spots. Great IPA’s with flavorful sours and a constantly changing tap of odd and different beers. A must try beer experience.

reviews_data.review_text: Easily one of the best, most unique and inventive breweries in Charlotte. We didn’t have a single bad beer during our visit. Plus the space is open and awesome and the service was excellent. Definitely recommend if you’re making a beer pilgrimage to Charlotte.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you so much for the incredible review, and we really appreciate the kind words, R D! We look forward to serving you again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Food truck at the door, table top corn hole, tasty beverages, good vibe.  One more strawberry tamale please!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thanks so much for the wonderful recommendation! We love Hot Tamale Truck for Taco Tuesday. It’s hard to beat $2 tacos and tamales all night!

reviews_data.review_text: They've always got some stellar beers on tap and they've also got that skittles game that I can't seem to get a hang of.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thanks so much for the wonderful review! Please don’t be frustrated w/ Skittles. Nobody can figure it out 😂😂😂

reviews_data.review_text: Not bad. It was quiet today but overall good experience. Service was welcoming.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thanks Carlos. We appreciate the feedback. Hopefully next time it’ll be a great experience.

reviews_data.review_text: This is by far one of the best breweries in Charlotte. Large open space with lots of natural light, on top of the beautiful farmhouse chic decor/reclaimed feel, makes for a wonderful ambiance. Spent our day doing an engagement shoot inside the brewery with permission from the company and I can say we sampled the beer after our shoot- some of the best I've had. This place is wonderful for events, I would highly recommend booking them. The barrel room is gorgeous too. What a wonderfully aesthetically beautiful place to relax and have a great time. Food is close by too (across the way noodle restaurant).
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you immensely for such a wonderful review, Christy! We truly appreciate the kind words! You guys were so great to work with, and we love to try to work with any interested parties that show interest (if we can manage it)

reviews_data.review_text: Love it here! Dog friendly, staff is super cool and nice, and a very chill vibe - great place to hang and chat with existing friends or make some new ones!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thanks so much for the amazing review, Jan! We definitely want a relaxed vibe, and we love all of our patrons that walk through these doors! We think of y’all as our friends!

reviews_data.review_text: A chill, fun atmosphere!   They frequently have live music, and I like the fact that they have outdoor space.  Very creative and unusual ales on tap as well.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you so much for such a kind review, Martin! We truly appreciate the love and support. We look forward to serving you again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Ok brewery. My first experience was on their 1 year anniversary. They bruhhh in a band and set up a tent in the rain which was a solid move. But the whole place smelled weird abd i have been in away least 100 breweries. Beer menu was good and had diversity. Only had 1 beer I didn't like but that was just my taste. Overall liked it
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thanks for the review. We’re sorry you thought it smelled weird. This is literally the first time anyone has mentioned that, so maybe it was the hundreds of people in here. Hope next visit is a 5 star one!

reviews_data.review_text: first visit.  it's kinda hidden on side of building, but totally worth scouting this new neighberhood brewery.  got try both IPA and stout which were top notch. though sours aren't my thing, overhearing othet patrons raving about the sours.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thanks so much for coming to see us Jason! So glad you enjoyed your visit, and hope to see you again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Tasty sours.
reviews_data.owner_answer: So glad you enjoy our sours! We are always trying to come up w/ new and exciting sours. Come back and see us again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: El espacio es increíble. Hacen actividades de todo tipo como libres de trivia, clases de yoga con cerveza incluida al final, la última noche de miércoles hay una terapia con perritos, etc. El único problema es que si bien hay una buena cantidad de cervezas, no me tocó probar una sobresaliente. Todas eran buenas pero no lo más memorable del lugar. No falla pero no es el gran éxito que se pueda desear.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you very much for the review, Evaristo! Come back to visit us again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Every beer they brew in every category is great.  Little pricey, but the beer is excellent.  Also nice they're open till 10pm on Sunday.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thanks so much for the great review Mitchell! We are very conscientious about our pricing, and we keep much of the costs within industry norms. We truly appreciate the wonderful support, and look forward to having you back again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Consistently good beer and friendly service. I really like the layout here as well. Plus, they are open earlier than a lot of other breweries which is great for date days or getting some work done while you sip some delicious brews!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you so much for the wonderful review, Tanna! We truly appreciate the kind words, and can’t wait to see you again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Good beer, good atmosphere and good serving staff. I enjoyed their beers and will definitely return.  Try it when in north Charlotte.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you very much for the review, Ed! We look forward to serving you again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Great place. Service is excellent. Bartender even talked to our group for an extended time about brewing while the place was packed!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you so much for such a great review, Nicholas! We truly appreciate it, and love being able to discuss our passion with new friends! We hope to see you in the taproom again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Awesome brewery, clean and spacious. Good beer too! Stopped in on a whim while traveling through Charlotte and was very glad we did.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thanks so much for coming through! We really appreciate the wonderful review, and hope you can make it back next time you’re in Charlotte!

reviews_data.review_text: Nice brewery, great beer options. Lots of flavors! Staff was super friendly and helpful also cool games to play around the bar we'll be back soon!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you so much for the kind words and wonderful review, Janna! We hope you’ll come back out to see us again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Nice atmosphere, good beer. The night I went they had live music which was very nice. They offer a wide array of different beers including several sours which I enjoyed very much. Very friendly and attentive staff.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you Jonathan, and come on back to see us again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Great tasting room with excellent beers. No food.
reviews_data.owner_answer:
Thank you so much for the kind words, and really appreciate the review! Come on back out to see us soon.

In terms of food options: You can find delicious, healthy light meals and snacks in our cooler that’s restocked twice a week by Chop & Chisel. There is a Thai restaurant, Deejai, in the same parking lot that will deliver your meal to our taproom if you order. We’ll also have food trucks out to the brewery 5 out of 7 days a week!

reviews_data.review_text: Best beers in Charlotte! Excellent atmosphere and cool, new food trucks all the time!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you so much for such a kind review, Hillary! We truly appreciate it, and we hope you’ll come back to see us again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Great atmosphere and great beer!  Just needs a permanent food option.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thanks so much for coming to see us, John. We have Deejai Thai right across the parking lot from us that will always deliver to our taproom, a fridge that is stocked bi-weekly with healthy and delicious light meals/snacks. We also have food trucks that come on our most popular days. Thank you so much again, and we hope you’ll come back to see us again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: So I was very impressed with their beers!!! The cranberry ginger....the pancake porter....the mr green geans....all were great! Service was great...bartenders knew the beers very well and helped to create an atmosphere that was welcoming.   The space had great games! I will definitely go back.
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you so much for all of the kind words, Suzanne! You have no idea how much it means to us, as well as you enjoying your experience with us!

reviews_data.review_text:
The beer here is really tasteful and there is a lot of variety in different brews. They've got everything from high gravity porters to complex sours.

The board games that they have all over are a big reason I keep coming back. It's fun to play games with friends while enjoying adult beverages
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you so much for the wonderful review Colin! We truly appreciate it, and are so glad you enjoy your time here. That is exactly the vibe we want for people! Come back and see us again soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Beautiful open space, great beer, cool staff!!
reviews_data.owner_answer: Thank you so much for the wonderful review, Tanya! We truly appreciate the support! We look forward to serving you again soon!
